instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2179: What is A2179? A2179 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2020 with EMC 3302, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01958..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> intermitent shutdown?
threads.message:
anybody got facing this kind of issue?
motherboard is clean all voltages are normal.
battery cycle 118 only condition is normal.
there is a sudden shutdown sometimes restarts.
sometimes wholeday play video never shutdown or restart. 
only i notice if battery below 30% it will shutdown. 
can be the battery?

[ATTACH type="full" width="397px" alt="2023_02_20_13_14_IMG_2605.jpg"]61005[/ATTACH]

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> intermitent shutdown?
threads.message:
You can try to discard a software issue first, doing DFU restore.

As you noted battery related problem, should test with known good one; not chinese new.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> intermitent shutdown?
threads.message:
replaced new battery (original) still same. 
will update later after trying nextstep (software)
thanks
